title: Lesson A1-1 Assessment: The Georgian Alphabet

questions.question: How many letters are in the Mkhedruli alphabet?
questions.explanation: The Mkhedruli alphabet consists of exactly 33 letters: 5 vowels and 28 consonants.

questions.question: Does Georgian have uppercase and lowercase letters like English?

options.text: No, each letter has only one form

questions.explanation: Georgian has no distinction between uppercase and lowercase letters. Each letter has a single form, which actually makes learning easier!

questions.question: How many vowels does Georgian have?
questions.explanation: Georgian has 5 vowels: ა [a], ე [e], ი [i], ო [o], and უ [u].

questions.question: What is an ejective consonant?

options.text: A consonant made with extra air
A consonant made with glottal closure (a 'pop' sound)
A consonant only used in formal speech

questions.explanation: Ejective consonants are produced with a glottal closure, creating a distinctive 'pop' sound. Georgian has 6 ejective consonants: კ, პ, ტ, წ, ჭ, and ყ.

questions.question: Match the letters to their sounds:
questions.explanation: Remember: თ is aspirated (with air), კ is ejective (with pop), ა is vowel [a], and ბ is regular [b].

questions.question: Which of these are vowels? Select all correct answers.
questions.explanation: Georgian has exactly 5 vowels: ა [a], ე [e], ი [i], ო [o], and უ [u]. All other letters are consonants.

questions.question: What makes ejective consonants different from regular consonants?

options.text: They are produced with glottal closure, creating a 'pop' sound
They are always at the beginning of words
They are only used in formal speech

questions.explanation: Ejective consonants are produced by closing the glottis (vocal cords) and then releasing, creating a distinctive 'pop' sound. This is a unique feature of Georgian phonology.
